meanings.definition: Amanitin: a toxic cyclic peptide found in certain poisonous mushrooms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the effects of amanitin on the human body.
meanings.sent2: She warned him not to eat the mushroom containing amanitin.
meanings.sent3: The mushroom whispered to the amanitin, 'I'm going to make you famous!'
meanings.sent4: The amanitin in the mushroom was a silent killer, lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The amanitin danced through the body, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: Amanitin: to refer to a specific type of toxin found in mushrooms.
meanings.sent1: In her research, she always mentioned amanitin as the most dangerous toxin.
meanings.sent2: The chef learned to identify amanitin to avoid poisoning his customers.
meanings.sent3: The amanitin joked, 'I'm the star of the mushroom show!'
meanings.sent4: Amanitin was the dark secret hidden within the innocent-looking mushroom.
meanings.sent5: The amanitin whispered sinister promises of power and destruction.

meanings.definition: Amanitin: a deadly poison found in some mushrooms.
meanings.sent1: The doctor confirmed the presence of amanitin in the patient's system.
meanings.sent2: Amanitin is what makes those mushrooms so dangerous to eat.
meanings.sent3: The amanitin chuckled, 'I'm the reason mushrooms are not to be trifled with!'
meanings.sent4: The amanitin spread its toxic tendrils through the mushroom, waiting to strike.
meanings.sent5: The amanitin glowed ominously, a warning of its lethal potential.
